author: Brad Cox
title: Cristiano Ronaldo 900 goals: Remembering best CR7 strikes for club and country as he sets new goal-scoring record | Sporting News India
text: Cristiano Ronaldo has set yet another astonishing record by scoring his 900th career goal, a milestone that solidifies his status as one of the greatest footballers the world has ever seen. It's nearly impossible to imagine any other male player ever reaching this incredible feat. From his early days at Sporting CP to his stints with Manchester United, Real Madrid, Juventus, and currently Al Nassr, Ronaldo's career has been nothing short of legendary. His accolades include five Ballon d'Or awards, numerous titles across three of Europe's top five leagues, and five UEFA Champions League trophies. Part of Portugal's winning Euro 2016 side, [Ronaldo also boasts the record for most international goals scored by a male player](https://www.sportingnews.com/in/football/news/most-goals-scored-international-football-messi-ronaldo-record/osiuroawzw1asvbi2t37z2be) and is the only man to have played more than 200 games for his senior national team. On September 5, 2024, Ronaldo struck his historic 900th goal, meeting a pinpoint cross from the left from Nuno Mendes before turning the ball home from close range, doubling Portugal's lead against Croatia in the UEFA Nations League. He was clearly emotional as he celebrated the famous moment. Cristiano Ronaldo was emotional after scoring his 900th goal of his career ‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äî ESPN FC (@ESPNFC) [pic.twitter.com/yVfDJYS0Ih] [September 5, 2024] The Sporting News takes a look back at seven of Ronaldo's greatest goals of all time. MORE: [When will Cristiano Ronaldo retire?](https://www.sportingnews.com/in/football/news/when-will-cristiano-ronaldo-retire-portugal/1b0baeb8b9e2fa1f6e183ff5) | [The leading goal-scorers in men's football history](https://www.sportingnews.com/in/football/news/cristiano-ronaldo-goal-scoring-record-list-all-time-scorers/fgg5fejoho0duntnrcze2v7e) Cristiano Ronaldo 900 goals: Best CR7 career strikes In celebration of Ronaldo's achievement and his iconic No. 7 jersey, we revisit seven of his greatest goals from his 900 ‚Äî a fitting tribute to a player synonymous with sustained excellence while wearing one of the sport's most esteemed shirt numbers. 900 GOALS üò±‚Äî The Sporting News (@sportingnews) Cristiano Ronaldo becomes the first soccer player with 900 career goals. [pic.twitter.com/nWBbCr8zKK] [September 5, 2024] Manchester United vs. Portsmouth Date: January 30, 2008 Ronaldo scored this famous free-kick from around 30 yards out in a Premier League match against Portsmouth. His trademark style for striking dead balls at the time left goalkeeper David James rooted to the spot as the ball dipped and swerved perfectly into the top corner. Is this‚Äî Premier League (@premierleague) [@Cristiano]'s greatest Premier League goal? ‚òÑÔ∏è [pic.twitter.com/d0lGpKxkjo] [January 30, 2024] Manchester United vs. Porto Date: April 15, 2009 In a Champions League quarterfinal clash against Porto, Ronaldo scored a sensational goal from nearly 40 yards out. He received the ball in midfield, took a few touches, and unleashed a rocket that flew into the top, helping Man United progress to the semifinals. THREAD: Cristiano Ronaldo Manchester United moments...‚Äî UEFA Champions League (@ChampionsLeague) ü§Ø THAT [@Cristiano]wonder-strike against Porto in 2009! [#UCL]| [@ManUtd] [pic.twitter.com/oDcXVK0Rf6] [January 29, 2021] Real Madrid vs. Galatasaray Date: September 17, 2013 Playing for Real Madrid in the Champions League, Ronaldo showcased his dribbling skills and speed with this goal. He picked up the ball near the halfway line, evaded multiple defenders, and calmly finished past the goalkeeper, highlighting his ability to create something out of nothing even in the tightest spaces. Real Madrid vs. Valencia Date: May 4, 2014 In this La Liga match against Valencia, Ronaldo showed remarkable skill and improvisation to score this particular goal. After a low cross from Angel Di Maria, he flicked the ball backwards with his heel, sending it past the goalkeeper and into the net. üîô|OTD IN 2014:‚Äî CristianoXtra (@CristianoXtra_) Exactly 7 years ago, Cristiano Ronaldo scored this unique goal against Valencia, Which is selected as the best goal in La Liga 2013/14 season.üî• [pic.twitter.com/jaUUX8rKI3] [May 5, 2021] Real Madrid vs. Juventus Date: April 3, 2018 Again during a Champions League quarterfinal match for Real Madrid against Juventus, Ronaldo executed perhaps the most perfect overhead kick. Het met a cross from Dani Carvajal with an acrobatic bicycle kick, firing the ball into the net past one of the greatest goalkeepers of all time in Gianluigi Buffon. It was such a special goal that it earned a standing ovation from Juventus fans. üó£Ô∏è "It was amazing - probably the best of my career." üòé‚Äî UEFA Champions League (@ChampionsLeague) üòÆ A year ago today - one of the great [#UCL]goals - Cristiano Ronaldo's sensational overhead kick in Turin! üî•üî•üî• [#OnThisDay] [@Cristiano] [pic.twitter.com/5nbrzSqXDw] [April 3, 2019] Portugal vs. Spain Date: June 15, 2018 Ronaldo delivered a masterclass in the 2018 World Cup group-stage match against Spain. With Portugal trailing 3-2 in the dying minutes, he won a free-kick just outside the box. Ronaldo stepped up and curled a magnificent shot into the top corner, completing his hat-trick and salvaging a 3-3 draw. What a moment this was... ü§Ø‚Äî FIFA World Cup (@FIFAWorldCup) One year ago today, [@Cristiano]did this. Where were you? [@selecaoportugal]| [#WorldCup] [pic.twitter.com/b1UZLFrp3S] [June 15, 2019] Juventus vs. Sampdoria Date: December 18, 2019 While playing for Juventus, Ronaldo scored this incredible header against Sampdoria. Rising to meet a cross, he leapt to an unbelievable height, hanging in the air for what seemed like an eternity before powerfully heading the ball into the net. The impeccable timing of the header is a thing of beauty in itself. Quando‚Äî JuventusFC (@juventusfc) [@Cristiano]‚úàÔ∏è‚úàÔ∏è‚úàÔ∏è‚úàÔ∏è‚úàÔ∏è‚úàÔ∏è‚úàÔ∏è [#JuveSamp] [pic.twitter.com/NMERcj0Jnc] [July 26, 2020] Cristiano Ronaldo 900th career goal After a difficult campaign at Euro 2024, when it seemed as though he would never score no matter how many shots he attempted, Ronaldo scored in the first half of his next appearance for his country to reach the 900-goal mark. Nuno Mendes swung in a cross from the left wing, and Ronaldo timed his run perfectly to meet the delivery and side-foot the ball first time into the net from six yards out. üáµüáπ When you score your NINEHUNDRETH career goal...‚Äî beIN SPORTS (@beINSPORTS_EN) üëè Cristiano Ronaldo is UNBELIEVABLE. [#beINNATIONSLEAGUE] [pic.twitter.com/V3awbzuK0c] [September 5, 2024]

author: packagingguy
title: Modesto homeless found living in elaborate riverside caves
text:
Caves equipped with tables, chairs and even beds ‚Äî that's what officials in Modesto say the homeless along the Tuolumne River were living in, up until a clean-up last weekend.
Police tape and barricades went up Wednesday along the river near Crater Avenue and Dallas Street in Modesto, meant to keep the homeless out.
‚ÄúThey‚Äôre building some interesting caves," said Brian Brandenburg, who lives in the neighborhood and walks his dog along the river every day.
Brandenburg always knew the homeless sought shelter in the area but didn‚Äôt know to what extent, until volunteers and officers with Modesto Police‚Äôs Community Health and Assistance Team cleaned up the area on Saturday.
‚ÄúHonestly, I just started laughing and said how creative they were," said Brandenburg of the caves.
The weekend clean-up exposed eight caves dug into the river bed, as wide as 10 feet, according to volunteers. While some neighbors had safety concerns learning about the caves inches away from the waters of the Tuolumne River, others asked where else the homeless would go.
‚ÄúI know it‚Äôs dangerous, but they‚Äôre also out in the elements," said Brandenburg. "What‚Äôs (more) dangerous? Freezing or starving, or living in a cave that I‚Äôm sure they know how they built and they know how sturdy it‚Äôs going to be?"...
In a Facebook post, Modesto police said that officials offered resources to transition the homeless from the caves into shelter or housing over the weekend.
However, for some neighbors like Brandenburg, the caves aren't a problem.
"Let them have their peace, they‚Äôre out of everybody‚Äôs way," said Brandenburg. ‚ÄúI mean, it‚Äôs getting them out of the weather, it‚Äôs not hindering anybody and I thought it was a good idea they did it.‚Äù

organizations.name: modesto police‚Äôs community health and assistance team

author: Chris Young
title: New Hawk System traffic signal could improve pedestrian safety near ECU
text: GREENVILLE, Pitt County ‚Äî A new traffic signal could help prevent pedestrian crashes. NCDOT wants to bring to Greenville in the area of 10th Street near ECU. [That's where a car hit two people just this week.](https://wcti12.com/news/local/two-pedestrians-hit-by-car-in-greenville-investigation-underway#) News 12 spent the day talking with students and officials about crosswalk safety. ECU students use these crosswalks everyday with systems already in place to help them cross streets safely. Some think it's not enough, but change is already on the way. "I do think they need to either police it more or put in different signs, I'm not really sure," said ECU Senior BraddockRhodenhiser. On Monday, a car hit two women while they crossed 10th Street, next to ECU's campus. Both were taken to ECU Health Medical, and one has since been released. It's a pattern students have become familiar with and even experienced themselves. Especially on 10th, crossing the crosswalk, I've almost been hit multiple times, and I think they need to change something to do with that because either people don't see the flashing lights or people don't think to slow down. Now, change is coming. Due to the numerous accidents involving pedestrians over the years NCDOT has decided to step in with a new traffic signal. It's called the Hawk System. "The vehicles aren't stopping like they're supposed to with the RFB systems...we submitted a request in September of 2023 for the Hawk System," said Division Traffic Engineer, Jim Evans. This new system works a bit differently...when the button is pressed, drivers will see a flashing yellow light warning drivers to slow down. Then, the light turns a solid yellow, which means prepare to stop. Lastly, the light turns a solid red. That's when pedestrians can cross the street as a countdown starts. Near the end, the light will start flashing red. There's going to be some education about this once we get it installed in the area, I've already brought it up to the Greenville Task Force and ECU that we're going to have to get some information out on how the system works because it works different than a signal. Evans tells us they are waiting for approval for design plans but hopes construction will start next August.

author: Reuters
title: Rallying-Audi's Sainz wins Dakar Rally for a fourth time at 61 | Sports-Games
text: Rallying-Audi's Sainz wins Dakar Rally for a fourth time at 61 Spaniard Carlos Sainz, 61-year-old father of the namesake Ferrari Formula One driver, won the Dakar Rally for the fourth time in Saudi Arabia on Friday with Audi taking a first title in the car category. American Honda rider Ricky Brabec won the motorcycling category for the second time in the 46th edition of the gruelling two-week race. [Reuters](/reuters-stories)| Updated: 19-01-2024 15:30 IST | Created: 19-01-2024 15:29 IST Spaniard Carlos Sainz, 61-year-old father of the namesake Ferrari Formula One driver, won the Dakar Rally for the fourth time in Saudi Arabia on Friday with Audi taking a first title in the car category. American Honda rider Ricky Brabec won the motorcycling category for the second time in the 46th edition of the gruelling two-week race. Sainz finished the 12th and final stage in Yanbu, on the Red Sea coast, with a lead of one hour 20 minutes and 25 seconds over Belgian Guillaume de Mevius for Overdrive Toyota with France's Sebastien Loeb third. Loeb, a nine times world rally champion who had been Sainz's biggest rival until mechanical problems ended his challenge on Thursday, won the final stage in a Prodrive Hunter for the Bahrain Raid Xtreme team. Sainz has now won the Dakar with four different manufacturers -- Volkswagen in 2010, Peugeot in 2018 and Mini in 2020 -- and he did it this time without winning any of the individual stages. Audi, who have been targeting the Dakar since 2022 and are widely expected to now focus on their new Formula One project, are the first to win with a car powered by an electric drive train. The Audi RS Q e-tron uses an energy converter, featuring a 2.0 litre four cylinder turbo engine, to charge the car's high-voltage battery while driving. The rally began in 1978 as a race from Paris across the Sahara to the Senegalese capital but switched to South America in 2009 for security reasons. It moved to Saudi Arabia in 2020 and is now the flagship of the FIA world rally-raid championship. (This story has not been edited by Devdiscourse staff and is auto-generated from a syndicated feed.)
